title: 103_hr923
content: The "Mowa Band of Choctaw Indians Recognition Act" grants federal recognition to the Mowa Band of Choctaw Indians of Alabama, extending all applicable Federal laws to them. The Mowa Band of Choctaw Indians Recognition Act restores all rights and privileges previously abrogated by Federal law and ratifies the cession of historical tribal lands to the United States. The Mowa Band of Choctaws' historical land claims against the United States, states, or entities are extinguished as of the cession date. They cannot use their Federal recognition to assert any historical land claims based on being native inhabitants or their status as native Americans. The Act does not affect property rights, contract obligations, or tax payments prior to its enactment. The Act does not affect property rights, contract obligations, or tax payments prior to its enactment. lands Sec. 4 of the Act transfers legal rights and interests in lands held by the Mowa Band of Choctaw Indians of Alabama to the United States in trust for their benefit. The Band is required to transfer any interest in lands acquired after the enactment of the Act to the Secretary of the Interior for the United States to hold in trust. The Attorney General of the United States must approve any conveyance deeds. The Mowa Band of Choctaw Indians of Alabama's lands held in trust by the United States will be considered the Band's reservation. Congress enacted the provisions in the best interests of the Band at their request. The Mowa Band of Choctaw Indians of Alabama and its members are eligible for federal services and benefits provided to recognized Indians, regardless of reservation status or residence location. The Mowa Band of Choctaw Indians of Alabama can adopt a constitution and bylaws with assistance from the Secretary of the Interior, which must be filed with the Secretary to take effect. Membership of the Mowa Band of Choctaw Indians of Alabama is determined by tribal membership rolls or descent until a constitution is adopted. The Secretary of the Interior will create necessary regulations for the implementation of the Act.
